intro: Hesperantha flexuosa, commonly known as the zigzag lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of blooms on tall, slender stems. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Hesperantha flexuosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a cut flower.
